Package algorithms.search

Class MiscBisectingSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.search.MiscBisectingSearch
  • public class MiscBisectingSearch
extends java.lang.Object
    useful methods for bisecting search, a.k.a. binary search

    • Method Detail

      • successor

        public static int successor​(int[] a,
                            int srch)
        finds where srch would be inserted such that all keys at indexes < resulting index have smaller values than srch. if srch is larger than all array elements, this method returns an index larger than last array index. 
        
     a = [2, 2]
     srch = 1,
     returns index 0

     a = [2, 2]
     srch = 2,
     returns index 2

     a = [2, 2]
     srch = 2,
     returns index 2
        Parameters:
        a -
        srch -
        Returns:
        smallest index i such that a[i] is GT srch. range of returned value is is [0, n] where n is a.length.

      • findInsertIndex

        public static int findInsertIndex​(int[] a,
                                  int srch)
        find the least index i whose value a]i] EQ srch, else finds the least index i whose value a[i] is GT srch. The method returns indexes in the range [-1, a.length], inclusive. The return valye of a.length means that srch is larger than all values in the array. Note that one could instead use the java.util.Arrays.binarySearch(...) and if the index is negative, you can convert it with mult by -1 and then subtract 1 ( i.e. idx = -(insertion point) - 1, so insertion point = -idx - 1).
        Parameters:
        a -
        srch -
        Returns:
        range is [0, n] inclusive where n = a.length.

      • findInsertIndex

        public static int findInsertIndex​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> a,
                                  int srch)
        find the least index i whose value a]i] EQ srch, else finds the least index i whose value a[i] is GT srch. The method returns indexes in the range [-1, a.length], inclusive. The return valye of a.length means that srch is larger than all values in the array. Note that one could instead use the java.util.Arrays.binarySearch(...) and if the index is negative, you can convert it with mult by -1 and then subtract 1 ( i.e. idx = -(insertion point) - 1, so insertion point = -idx - 1).
        Parameters:
        a -
        srch -
        Returns:
        range is [0, n] inclusive where n = a.length.

        Returns:

      • floor

        public static int floor​(int[] a,
                        int srch)
        Finds the smallest index for which value == srch, or if doesn't exist, finds the largest index for which the value is LT srch. This is a floor function. If the method returns -1, the srch is smaller than all elements in the array. if srch is larger than every element in list 'a', this method will return the last index of a. 
             e.g.

     a = [0,1,2,2,3]
     srch = 2
     returns  2

     a = [0,3,4,4,6};
     srch = 5;
     returns 3

     a = [2,3,4,4,6};
     srch = 0;
     returns -1

     a = [2,3,4,4,6};
     srch = 7;
     returs 4
        Parameters:
        a - an ascending ordered list (non-decreasing, adjacent values can be ==).
        srch - the value to search for in a
        Returns:
        the floor index, that is, finds the smallest index for which value == srch, or if doesn't exist, finds the largest index for which the value is LT srch. range of values from floor is [-1, a.length-1] inclusive.

      • floor

        public static int floor​(int[] a,
                        int srch,
                        int lo,
                        int hi)
        Finds the smallest index for which value == srch, or if doesn't exist, finds the largest index for which the value is LT srch. This is a floor function. If the method returns -1, the srch is smaller than all elements in the array. if srch is larger than every element in list 'a', this method will return the last index of a. 
             e.g.

     a = [0,1,2,2,3]
     srch = 2
     returns  2

     a = [0,3,4,4,6};
     srch = 5;
     returns 3

     a = [2,3,4,4,6};
     srch = 0;
     returns -1

     a = [2,3,4,4,6};
     srch = 7;
     returs 4
        Parameters:
        a - an ascending ordered list (non-decreasing, adjacent values can be ==).
        srch - the value to search for in a
        lo - smallest index for search range
        hi - largets index for search range, inclusive.
        Returns:
        the floor index, that is, finds the smallest index for which value == srch, or if doesn't exist, finds the largest index for which the value is LT srch. range of values from floor is [-1, a.length-1] inclusive.

      • floor

        public static int floor​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> a,
                        int srch)
        Finds the smallest index for which value == srch, or if doesn't exist, finds the largest index for which the value is LT srch. This is a floor function. If the method returns -1, the srch is smaller than all elements in the array. if srch is larger than every element in list 'a', this method will return the last index of a. 
             e.g.

     a = [0,1,2,2,3]
     srch = 2
     returns  2

     a = [0,3,4,4,6};
     srch = 5;
     returns 3

     a = [2,3,4,4,6};
     srch = 0;
     returns -1

     a = [2,3,4,4,6};
     srch = 7;
     returs 4
        Parameters:
        a - an ascending ordered list (non-decreasing, adjacent values can be ==).
        srch - the value to search for in a
        Returns:
        the floor index, that is, finds the smallest index for which value == srch, or if doesn't exist, finds the largest index for which the value is LT srch.

                        int lo,
                        int hi)

      • ceiling

        public static int ceiling​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> a,
                          int srch)
        find the largest index i whose value a[i] EQ srch, else if no value exists this method returns the smallest index whose value is GT srch. if all values in the array are less than srch, the method returns index == array size which is beyond bounds of array. 
             for example:
     a       = [1, 2, 3, 3, 4]
     indexes =  0  1  2  3  4

     ceil of srch=3 is index 3
     ceil of srch=4 is index 4
     ceil of srch=9 is index 5
     ceil of srch=0 is index 0
        Parameters:
        a - an ascending ordered list (non-decreasing, adjacent values can be ==).
        srch - the value to search for in a
        Returns:
        the greatest index i for which a[i] == srch, else if no such value exists, the index for the smallest value GT srch. range is [0, n] inclusive where n = a.length.

      • ceiling

        public static int ceiling​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> a,
                          int srch,
                          int lo,
                          int hi)
        find the largest index i whose value a[i] EQ srch, else if no value exists this method returns the smallest index whose value is GT srch. if all values in the array are less than srch, the method returns index == array size which is beyond bounds of array. 
             for example:
         a       = [1, 2, 3, 3, 4]
         indexes =  0  1  2  3  4

         ceil of srch=3 is index 3
         ceil of srch=4 is index 4
         ceil of srch=9 is index 5
         ceil of srch=0 is index 0
        Parameters:
        a - an ascending ordered list (non-decreasing, adjacent values can be ==).
        srch - the value to search for in a
        lo - smallest index of search range
        hi - largest index of search range
        Returns:
        the greatest index i for which a[i] == srch, else if no such value exists, the index for the smallest value GT srch. range is [0, n] inclusive where n = a.length.

      • predecessor

        public static int predecessor​(int[] a,
                              int srch)
        find the greatest index i whose value a[i] is LT srch.
        Parameters:
        a - list sorted by ascending values
        srch - value to srch for predecessor of.
        Returns:
        the greatest index i whose value a[i] is LT srch. range is [-1, n-1] where n = a.length.
